intro: Homoranthus cummingii, commonly known as the dwarf fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and southeastern United States. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family, which includes species like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, resembling tiny lanterns. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
